resources.string: Basic Hungarian Course
In this session you will practice 3 types of basic suffixes used to define where something is, or where it is going to.\n\nWe will use only 4 Hungarian words:

In Hungarian language the usage of suffixes depends on the sound order of the word. There are 3 types of sound orders: high, deep and mixed. In this session we will practice only the first two types. In these types the used suffix has to be in the same sound order as the word itself.
Vocals of high sound order: e, é, i, í, ö, ő, ü, ű\nVocals of deep sound order: a, á, o, ó, u, ú
Take a look at the below picture which shows you the suffixes you can use to express the correct states.\n\nIf you are ready to practice, click on the start button.
Choose the correct form of the Hungarian words!
With which words can you use the suffix: -ben?
